snippet: The agreement would put an end to a costly duplication of security controls on the more than $130 billion in air freight that crosses the Atlantic from Europe each year.
lead_paragraph: PARIS -- The United States and the European Union were expected Friday to announce an agreement to recognize each other's air cargo security regimes, putting an end to a costly duplication of security controls on the more than $130 billion in air freight that crosses the Atlantic from Europe each year. Under the terms of the accord, which was to take effect immediately, the U.S. Transportation Security Administration will fully accept a set of E.U. rules that holds all airlines and freight shippers flying cargo and mail into, or transiting via, the Union to a strict set of obligations on the screening of consignments and on the maintenance of a secure supply chain.

headline.main: U.S. and European Union Agree on Air Cargo Security
